original: DAHLSTRÖM, Sten Ingemar, Bergsingenjör, Långshyttan, f Norberg, Västml l, 3/6 03 av bergsing J R D o Eva Olsson, gm Ingegerd Olsson. Studex Sthlm 22, KTH (metallurgi) 22—28. Metallograf v Fagersta Bruks AB 28, driftsing v järnsvampsanl i Sandviken 29, konstr v Jones and Laughlin Steel Corp Pittsburgh Pä USA 30—31, övering.ass v Domn-arvets Jvk 31—36, martining v Kockums Jvks AB Kallinge 36—42, avd.ing f hytta, martin o elektrostålverk v Fagersta Bruks AB, Klosterverken, sed. 42. °DAHRi, Konstantin, Lektor, Göteborg, f Jönkp 13/4 98 av folksk.insp C R Johansson-D o Jenny Wigh. Studex Jönkp 16, KTH (E) 17—21. Fil kand StHS 23, fil mag 24, fil lic 26. Ing v Telegrafvkts linjebyrå 21—22, ass 1 elektr mättekn KTH 22—25 o 28—31, ass i telegrafi o telef där 23—25, l:e ass å lab f elektr mättekn samt telegrafi o telef 27, ass i matematik o mek 25 o 27—29, ass i inatem 27—31, uppehöll en del av undervisn o examination i teoret eltekn 25—27 o 29, lär i eltekn v Tekn sk i Sthlm 24—25, i el.lära o eltekn AIHS 28—32, i eltekn KSHS 31—32, lekt i eltekn o maskintekn v Tekn lärov i Örebro 32, nu lekt i eltekn CTH. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Beitrag zur allgemeinen Theorie der Vierpole und Kettenleiter (Ånn d Phys 34), tiber die exåkten Lösungen einiger Poten-tialprobleme aus der Elektrotechnik bei einer speziellen Klasse von Randkurven (ibid), Re-searches upon an integral equation exempli-fying the use of a general method due to Fredholm (Ark f matem, astr o fys 34), A course of integrational and operational cal-culus (35) mfl.
translated:
DAHLSTRÖM, Sten Ingemar, Mining Engineer, Långshyttan, born in Norberg, Västmanland on June 3, 1903, son of Mining Engineer J. R. D. Dahlström and Eva Olsson, married to Ingegerd Olsson. Graduated from Stockholm University in 1922, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) (metallurgy) 1922-1928. Metallographer at Fagersta Bruks AB in 1928, operating engineer at the iron sponge plant in Sandviken in 1929, designer at Jones and Laughlin Steel Corp in Pittsburgh, USA from 1930 to 1931, assistant engineer at Domnarvet JVK from 1931 to 1936, martin engineer at Kockums JVK AB in Kallinge from 1936 to 1942, department engineer for smelting, martin and electric steelworks at Fagersta Bruks AB, Klosterverken since 1942.

DAHRI, Konstantin, Lecturer, Gothenburg, born in Jönköping on April 13, 1898, son of primary school inspector C. R. Johansson-Dahlri and Jenny Wigh. Graduated from Jönköping University in 1916, KTH (engineering) from 1917 to 1921. Bachelor of Arts in Humanities from Stockholm University in 1923, Bachelor of Arts in Humanities in 1924, Licentiate of Arts in 1926. Engineer at the Telegraph Administration's Line Bureau from 1921 to 1922, assistant in electrical measurement technology at KTH from 1922 to 1925 and 1928 to 1931, assistant in telegraphy and telephony from 1923 to 1925, senior assistant at the laboratory for electrical measurement technology, telegraphy, and telephony in 1927, assistant in mathematics and mechanics in 1925 and 1927 to 1929, assistant in mathematics in 1927 to 1931, conducted part of the teaching and examinations in theoretical electrical engineering from 1925 to 1927 and 1929, taught electrical engineering at the Technical School in Stockholm from 1924 to 1925, taught electricity and electrical engineering at the Agricultural and Industrial High School from 1928 to 1932, taught electrical engineering at the College of Engineering in Karlstad 1931-1932, currently teaches electrical engineering at Chalmers University of Technology. Member of the Swedish Society of Engineers. Publications: Contribution to the general theory of four-poles and chain conductors (issued in Annals of Physics, 1934), On the exact solutions of some potential problems in electrical engineering of a specific class of boundary curves (ibid), Researches upon an integral equation exemplifying the use of a general method due to Fredholm (issued in Archives of Mathematics, Astronomy, and Physics, 1934), A course of integrational and operational calculus (1935), and more.
